intro: Ardisia adenopes, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its berries, which turn red when mature, are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia adenopes is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
